title: Dairy-Free Pancakes
ingredients: 1 cup non-dairy milk (almond, soy, rice, oat)
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract, whisking until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium-high heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake onto the griddle.
Cook until bubbles form and edges are dry, about 2-3 minutes per side.

title: Gluten-Free Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup unsalted butter, softened, or non-dairy butter (Nuttelex)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
In a bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, cream together butter, sugar, and brown sugar.
Beat in eggs and vanilla until smooth.
Gradually add flour mixture, mixing well. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Vegan Movie Night Choc Chip Pretzel Cookies
description: These cookies mix sweet chocolate chips with salty pretzels in a delightful vegan treat perfect for movie nights.
ingredients: Non-dairy milk 4 tbsp (soy, oat, almond, rice)
Non-dairy chocolate 100g (chips, chunks, chopped up chocolate bar)
instructions: Combine sugars, oil, non-dairy milk, and vanilla in a bowl, whisking until well mixed.
Gradually sift in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt, ensuring no clumps remain.
Incorporate chopped pretzels and stir in most of the chocolate, reserving some for topping.
Portion the dough on a lined baking sheet and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Preheat oven to 180 ºC, line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Arrange dough with space for spreading, bake for 10-12 minutes.
Allow to cool before serving. Store in a cool, dry place.

title: Classic Shepherd’s Pie
description: A comforting and hearty dish featuring a savory lamb mince filling topped with a golden crust.
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepan, sauté carrots, onions, and celery until soft.
Add lamb mince, cook while breaking up lumps, then add flour and stir.
Mix in beef stock, bay leaf, Worcestershire sauce, and tomato paste, bring to a boil.
Simmer for 30 minutes until thick, season, and either cover with pastry or mashed potatoes.
Bake at 200ºC for 20 minutes until golden.

title: Vegan Buttery Soft Pretzels
description: These vegan pretzels are soft, buttery, and perfect for snacking with a classic twist and rock salt topping.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon melted vegan butter (more for greasing)
¼ cup baking soda for bath
Extra melted vegan butter for garnish
instructions: Whisk sugar and yeast, add warm water, let rest until foamy.
Add flour and melted butter, stir to form a dough, knead until smooth.
Let dough rise in a warm spot until doubled.
Form dough into pretzels, prepare baking soda bath, dip each pretzel.
Bake at 200°C for 12-15 minutes until golden. Serve with vegan butter or mustard.

title: Sausage Rolls
description: Hearty and flavorful sausage rolls made with minced beef, vegetables, and herbs, wrapped in a crispy pastry.
ingredients: 2 sheets puff pastry (replacement: gluten and dairy-free puff pastry)
Soy milk to brush pastry with
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Dice the whole carrots.
Place all ingredients into a bowl and mix together.
Cut each pastry sheet in half and roll the mixture into a sausage-like shape, place in the middle of the pastry, roll pastry to cover sausage.
Cut each roll into 4-5 pieces.
Brush the top of each roll with a little amount of milk.
Bake for 30-40 minutes until pastry is golden.
